We refer to elements to a trade setup. There's really just two primary concerns and one is obviously context or framework surrounding the idea. We're going to be talking about retracements and what tool or concept we used for retracements. Reversal and lastly consolidation. Each one of these four give a specific framework and a context to the marketplace that you're going to be trading in. They can only be one of these four conditions. Either the market is going to be expanding, running away in other words, trimming, a retracement or rollback, altogether reversal. Now the other characteristic we use for defining elements to a trade setup is using these four criteria for context and framework to specific reference point in institutional order flow. So it's all computer based now it used to be open I'll cry in the pits but there's no longer an auction market it's all AI and it's based on principles I've been teaching for about seven years now. title: ICT Mentorship Core Content - Month 1 - Elements Of A Trade Setup
